author: Luke_Skytalker
title: X-Fun Baseplate!
review:
This is the best baseplate I own, I use it for my city. At the present time my city is really only a small multi-story complex with a landing space Cloud City styles. I have twelve of these and I have set them up in a six by two alignment so that the city is not to fat that you stand in it. It is also the perfect number to place my extra long train track in that I have not used since last year. The only problem I have come across in the baseplates alignment is that it easily slides out of place. I secure that by placing a four by four tile over where ech corners meet. The green Grocer set just got released today and I hope in the future, when I have collected all Star wars then these baseplates will support the whole town buildings. Right now though, the baseplates are being used to hold junk, really. I need the street sweeper set to clean it up. The problem is that I like seeing things blown up, really. 

There isn't much to review, unless I would individually review each stud. The grey colour really captures the city look, and since they are all stuck together I can't make two different scenes. I do own a green baseplate, and it is usefull once in a while for creating field scenes, usually with the MTT. 

With all my baseplates, I hope to make a model of Coruscant, with the classic Dexter's Diner. Right now my main goal is to raise to train track and get it level with the second story of my complex.

This is better than roads, because of mainly two reasons. Firstly, with roads, they are completely flat in the road part. No minifigure can safely stand in the middle of the road. In this, you can make your own road. Secondly, when you make your own road, you can make it as wide as you want, instead of having cars too big or too small on your road. All you need is a few flat pieces. It is also better than a stream or cusomized baseplate becuase this one has no limits and you can do whatever you want with it.

Overall this is a very good way to start off your city or, as it says, whatever you imagination leads you to. The pricing is a little concerning, put together it is, at least. I think that it is worth it and whatever happens you are bound to find a practical use for it. Buy this set in lots of two. it soon seems less and less. You need to buy this set, it may not seem like much, but it is worth it in the long run. Trust me, I know.

Luke Skytalker

author: donneyboy
title: a great building piece
review:
i got this set when i was younger, and i love it. it is great to build houses, bases, or anything on it. my friend and i would build two bases on it, one for me, and one for him, then we would have a battle. now i dont, i just build on it. 

pros- 
great for building
fun to use

cons-
hard to store
put to much weight on it, and it bends when you pick it up.

author: hustla187
title: Alot to Do with This
review: If you are a creative Lego builder, you can create alot of things like forts, bases, and castles. But where are you going to put it? This extra large base plate is what you need for anything that you want to build. 5 out of 5.

author: legoindyfan
title: It's neat; but my brother owns it.
review:
This set seems the best to make bases on, like the 2006 City Hospital Baseplate. The only problem is that my brother wants it for only himself. I'm going to ask him if we can divide it in two, so we can play both. So, if I lost time with talking about my brother, here is my rating: 

                                       Pros:
                                       large 
                                       great
''Now of course there is not much to say about it. I cannot find cons for it, tough.

author: HQuiff
title: The Great Gray Baseplate
review:
I bought this over a year ago on Holiday in England for £6.99, and trust me, it is absolutely wonderful, and hugely appealing, as well as being useful and handy. 

I've used it already for about 6 - 7 Creations, and seeing as it's just completely gray (And huge) you can use it for ANY theme, for ANY building, or even as an outside place.

That's about it really, I'm currently using it for my Plaza and Skatepark. Hope you found my review useful!
HQuiff

author: greshmalum
title: what to do
review: if you have this set you can build lots of things! I have built construction sites, castles, forts, and other stuff. mine is cracked because i use it SO much! you don't have to get this size, i admitt it is rare.also, it is extra-large!

author: Squidtron
title: Base-Plate
review:
This is a great Big board it's HUGE. You can build anything on it. But since it's only 1 piece, thats all I can say about it.

Now for the Cool/Not Cool things about this set.
Big(+3)
Loads of Possibilities(+2)

author: BuilderBrothers
title: Biggest Baseplate on the line
review: Well, there isn't much to say about this, many because its just one big piece.  However, I very highly recommend having at one of them, if not three or four, because they are perfect for putting Lego displays on.  The biggest baseplate ever created by Lego, this piece is a must have for all avid Lego builders.

author: Legonat
title: Probably took less than a dollar to manufacture!
review:
• I only got it because it was 50% off at TRU

            Pros

            Good for displaying or building large models


            Cons

            Hugely expensive,

            Easily cracked


            Overall a 2/5

author: AETerry
title: Ginormous Base Plate!
review:
As always, base plates are an absolute must when building and constructing sets and designs. And the X-Large Grey Baseplate is perfect for larger MOCs and builds.

At $15, the price seems step. Though when compared to resellers, this price is actually reasonable and as long as LEGO keeps making these, there should never be a reason to pay a higher price on these.

Though the more I think on it, the more it seems LEGO should consider releasing a blue plate that's an X-Large at 15"x15" to really capture an "at sea" scene. Or just even other colors like green or tan.

author: Doctor_Leg_O_Brick
title: What to put on a xl base plate.......
review:
Well, almost everythink! Police stations, nuclear testing grounds, army bases, castles, fire stations, building sites (ha ha!), the list gos on. 

 

THE BUILD

Whats their to build without bricks?

 

THE PARTS

What parts?

 

THE PLAYABILITY

Is their playabilty without the bricks?

 

THE MINI-FIGURES

What mini-figures?

 

THE MONEY

Good, very good. I was lucky because where i live only one place sells them.

 

THE OVERALL RATING

Amazing if you have bricks to spare. But if not, its just one big fat wobble board.

author: modena
title: Big!
review:
This was a great set, very big plate, and if you have two, it is easy to fit a big house. 

Pros:

  • Large!
  • Grey!
  • Plenty of space!

Cons:

  • Not a smooth surface (get the Lego city plates if that matters you)

Overall:

This is a really great set, so if you want it, then get maybe two. It will make everything easier. If you have sets that are crammed onto a single plate, like the 7894, then you could do with this set. 

Overall, this set will suit anyone!

author: bluefocus
title: A must have...But a bit expensive
review:
As the title sums it up, this set is a must have for any lego fan, weather you are just a kid who builds basic things or a ultimate lego collector. The size of this baseplate is also very good measuring 15''X15''. However, the price tag of it is not very appealing because I think that this is not worth more than £10. So from anywhere you get it, it would not be a sensible idea to spend more than £10.

 

Overall I rate this set 3/5

author: wipefeetnmat
title: Its a platform...
review: This is a great platform that you can build some really big creations on. Really helpful when building a city. It is a little expensive but the uses for it are endless. The one bricks for the playability and building experience are because there are none alone, not that its a bad piece.

author: Ernst
title: Multi use, also Duplo fits
review:
I normally explain each aspect but this set is not suited for that, just some reasons to own it:

 

1. multi use, both Lego and Duplo

2. useable for own creations but also to place regular sets on

3. timeless

4. good neutral colour

5. the size allows big or several buildings

 

Summarized : a must for every Lego fan !!

author: LEGOSWHP102
title: A LEGO Starts with the Baseplate
review:
A LEGO Starts with the Baseplate

If you are trying to create a type of building or battle scene, you have to get this baseplate. If you are trying to build a city or village you will need multiple baseplates to make it look totally awesome. It is not as big as I thought it was, but it is still very big. In my opinion, $14.99 for a 48x48 Baseplate is not that great of a deal, but it is still worth it. This is a must have for all LEGO Fans out there!

author: paul_merton
title: Great for mosaics
review:
I use these primarily for laying out custom 48x48 plate mosaics.  It's easy to forget that these have more than twice the surface area of a 32x32 baseplate, so don't forget to factor in the additional cost of plates when you're designing your own mosaics!

When I am rich and famous, I will buy a whole crate of these and use them as wall tiles. Why restrict myself to building on horizontal surfaces? :)
